info.title: ZEDEDA Edge Application Service
info.description: The ZEDEDA Edge Application Service is part of ZEDEDA Edge Orchestration Platform. This service enables customers to define their edge applications on ZEDEDA platform and to deploy/upgrade/restarti/monitor them to edge node(s) remotely. You can use the ZEDEDA Edge Application Service to provision and manage ilifecycle of thousands of edge applications to millions of edge nodes distributed in different geographical locations in a secure and scalable manner.

get.description: Query the edge application bundle records.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of invalid value of filter parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have application level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

parameters.name: summary
parameters.description: Only summary of the records required

parameters.name: filter.namePattern
parameters.description: query param : "name-pattern" . Search * namePattern * in name field to filter records

parameters.name: filter.originType
parameters.description:
origin of bundle

 - ORIGIN_UNSPECIFIED: default options, which says no Operation/Invalid Operation
 - ORIGIN_IMPORTED: Object imported from global enterprise.
 - ORIGIN_LOCAL: Objectl created locally.
 - ORIGIN_GLOBAL: Object created in global store,
to use this type user should have root previlage.

parameters.name: filter.category
parameters.description: category type of the bundle

parameters.name: filter.appCategory
parameters.description:
category type of the bundle

 - APP_CATEGORY_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid Edge Application Category
 - APP_CATEGORY_OPERATING_SYSTEM: Edge operating systems
 - APP_CATEGORY_INDUSTRIAL: Connectity solution for industrial protocols
 - APP_CATEGORY_EDGE_APPLICATION: Edge application framework featuring composite functions for data ingestion, buffering, analytics and export
 - APP_CATEGORY_NETWORKING: Edge networking services (e.g. SD-WAN, NFV)
 - APP_CATEGORY_SECURITY: Edge security services (e.g. protocol inspection, firewall)
 - APP_CATEGORY_DATA_ANALYTICS: Edge analytics (e.g. AI/ML) and data management (e.g. database, connectors) services
 - APP_CATEGORY_CLOUD_APPLICATION: Edge application runtimes, cloud connectivity and general application enablement
 - APP_CATEGORY_DEVOPS: Tools for Edge Application CI/CD and performance optimization
 - APP_CATEGORY_OTHERS: Miscellaneous functionality

parameters.name: filter.appType
parameters.description: app type, eg: vm, container, module

parameters.name: filter.deploymentType
parameters.description: type of deployment for the app, eg: azure, k3s, standalone

parameters.name: next.pageToken
parameters.description: Page Token

parameters.name: next.orderBy
parameters.description: OrderBy helps in sorting the list response

parameters.name: next.pageNum
parameters.description: Page Number

parameters.name: next.pageSize
parameters.description: Defines the page size

parameters.name: next.totalPages
parameters.description: Total number of pages to be fetched.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: User-Agent specified id to track a request

post.description: Create an edge application bundle record.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of missing parameter or invalid value of parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have application level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

409.description: Conflict. The API gateway did not process the request because this edge application record will conflict with an already existing edge application record.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

get.summary: Get edge application instance resource usage timeline
get.description: Get the resource usage timeline of an edge application instance as reported by the edge node where the edge application instance has been deployed.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have application level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

404.description: Not Found. The API gateway did not process the request because the requested resource could not be found.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

parameters.name: filter.runState
parameters.description:
aperation status

 - RUN_STATE_ONLINE: Entity Online
 - RUN_STATE_HALTED: Entity Halted
 - RUN_STATE_INIT: Entity Initializing
 - RUN_STATE_REBOOTING: Entity Rebooting
 - RUN_STATE_OFFLINE: Entity Offline
 - RUN_STATE_UNKNOWN: Entity state Unknown
 - RUN_STATE_UNPROVISIONED: Entity Unprovisioned
 - RUN_STATE_PROVISIONED: Entity Provisioned
 - RUN_STATE_SUSPECT: Entity Suspect
 - RUN_STATE_DOWNLOADING: Edge-node downloading entity artifacts
 - RUN_STATE_RESTARTING: Entity Restarting
 - RUN_STATE_PURGING: Entity Purging
 - RUN_STATE_HALTING: Entity Halting
 - RUN_STATE_ERROR: Entity encountered an error
 - RUN_STATE_VERIFYING: Verification of downloaded Artifacts in Progress.
 - RUN_STATE_LOADING: Loading of Artifacts into local datastore in Progress.
 - RUN_STATE_CREATING_VOLUME: Volume creation from artifacts in Progress
 - RUN_STATE_BOOTING: Entity booting up
 - RUN_STATE_MAINTENANCE_MODE: Entity maintenance mode

App.description: Edge application gets installed/uninstalled to/from edge node(s) and perform specific edge computing tasks. Lifecycle of Edge application (upgrade/restart) on Edge node can be managed and monitored by ZEDEDA Cloud controller through this detailed configuration.
App.title: Edge application detailed configuration

AppCategory.description:
- APP_CATEGORY_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid Edge Application Category
 - APP_CATEGORY_OPERATING_SYSTEM: Edge operating systems
 - APP_CATEGORY_INDUSTRIAL: Connectity solution for industrial protocols
 - APP_CATEGORY_EDGE_APPLICATION: Edge application framework featuring composite functions for data ingestion, buffering, analytics and export
 - APP_CATEGORY_NETWORKING: Edge networking services (e.g. SD-WAN, NFV)
 - APP_CATEGORY_SECURITY: Edge security services (e.g. protocol inspection, firewall)
 - APP_CATEGORY_DATA_ANALYTICS: Edge analytics (e.g. AI/ML) and data management (e.g. database, connectors) services
 - APP_CATEGORY_CLOUD_APPLICATION: Edge application runtimes, cloud connectivity and general application enablement
 - APP_CATEGORY_DEVOPS: Tools for Edge Application CI/CD and performance optimization
 - APP_CATEGORY_OTHERS: Miscellaneous functionality
AppCategory.title: Edge Application Category

EventSource.description:

 - EVENT_SOURCE_SYSTEM: Event is generated as a result of status change reported by edge node / application

EventSource.title: Source of events

underlayIP.description: Single IP address, either in IPv4 or in IPv6 format

country.description: Country code consisting of 2 capital letters as per ISO 3166-1 alpha2 standard

loc.description: Ordered pair of (latitude, longitude) separated by comma (,). Latitude is the horizontal component used for geographic positioning; it is the angle between 0° (the equator) and ±90° (north or south) at the poles measured in decimal degrees. It is the first value in an ordered pair. A negative number denotes a location south of the equator; a positive number is north. Longitude is the vertical component used for geographic positioning; it is the angle between 0° (the Prime Meridian) and ±180° (westward or eastward) measured in decimal degrees. It is the second number in an ordered pair. A negative number indicates a location west of Greenwich, England; a positive number east.

org.description: The name of the recipient, firm, or company at this geographical location.

postal.description: Postal code (ZIP code for USA) of the geographical location

latlong.description: Deprecated field: comma, separated lat, long

GeoLocation.description: Geographic location of an edge node determined by a variety of data collection mechanisms (e.g. network routing addresses or internal GPS devices).
GeoLocation.title: Geographic location of an edge node

InstanceTransitionAction.description:
- INSTANCE_TA_UNSPECIFIED: Default. Invalid option
 - INSTANCE_TA_NONE: Either Edge app bundle has not changed or Edge app bundle has
changed but the changes do not impact Edge app instances
 - INSTANCE_TA_UPDATEREQUIRED: Edge app bundle has changed. Changes impact Edge app Instances
Edge App instances need to be restarted with temporary loss of access
 - INSTANCE_TA_UPDATEWITHRESTART: Transition Action: Update with Restart
 - INSTANCE_TA_UPDATEWITHPURGE: Edge app bundle has changed. Changes impact Edge app Instances
Edge App instances need to be deleted and created again with
temporary loss of access and permanent loss of data
InstanceTransitionAction.title: Instance Transition action

name.description: Interface name used by the edge application

type.description: Physical Adapter type for this interface. Applicable only when "direct attach" flag is true.

optional.description: Indicates if the interface is optional for edge application.

directattach.description: If true, a physical adapter is assigned to the edge application directly. If false, a network instance is assigned to the edge application.

privateip.description: If true, DHCP network can't be assigned and user needs to provide a static IP address.

acls.description: Traffic access control rules for this interface. Applicable only when "direct attach" flag is false.

type.description: IoType specifies the type of the Input output of the device

 - IO_TYPE_OTHER: Other Io Types
IoType.title: Input/Output Type

to use this type user should have root previlage.

RunState.description:
- RUN_STATE_ONLINE: Entity Online
 - RUN_STATE_HALTED: Entity Halted
 - RUN_STATE_INIT: Entity Initializing
 - RUN_STATE_REBOOTING: Entity Rebooting
 - RUN_STATE_OFFLINE: Entity Offline
 - RUN_STATE_UNKNOWN: Entity state Unknown
 - RUN_STATE_UNPROVISIONED: Entity Unprovisioned
 - RUN_STATE_PROVISIONED: Entity Provisioned
 - RUN_STATE_SUSPECT: Entity Suspect
 - RUN_STATE_DOWNLOADING: Edge-node downloading entity artifacts
 - RUN_STATE_RESTARTING: Entity Restarting
 - RUN_STATE_PURGING: Entity Purging
 - RUN_STATE_HALTING: Entity Halting
 - RUN_STATE_ERROR: Entity encountered an error
 - RUN_STATE_VERIFYING: Verification of downloaded Artifacts in Progress.
 - RUN_STATE_LOADING: Loading of Artifacts into local datastore in Progress.
 - RUN_STATE_CREATING_VOLUME: Volume creation from artifacts in Progress
 - RUN_STATE_BOOTING: Entity booting up
 - RUN_STATE_MAINTENANCE_MODE: Entity maintenance mode
RunState.title: Run-time state of an object, reported by EVE

SWState.description:
- SW_STATE_RESOLVING_TAG: Prior to DOWNLOAD_STARTED we go through these:
Resolving an image tag
 - SW_STATE_RESOLVED_TAG: Tag has been resolved/failed
 - SW_STATE_CREATING_VOLUME: Prior to INSTALLED we go through these:
Volume create in progress
 - SW_STATE_CREATED_VOLUME: Volume create done/failed
 - SW_STATE_VERIFYING: Verification in-progress
 - SW_STATE_LOADING: Loading blob in CAS
 - SW_STATE_LOADED: Loaded blob in CAS
 - SW_STATE_AWAITNETWORKINSTANCE: Wait for network instance
SWState.title: State of EVE/Edge Application software

TotalMB.description: Total Storage for the device in MBs

UsedMB.description: How much is used within the allocated total storage

AllocatedMB.description: Total reserved for running applications + temp. images etc

acKind.description: UI map: N/A - not exposed to users
acKind.title: Edge Application type

acVersion.description: UI map: N/A - not exposed to users
acVersion.title: Manifest version

name.title: Unique id of app manifest, should match object name

displayName.title: Display name or title of app manifest

module.description: Azure module specific details like module twin, environment variable, routes
module.title: Module specific details

appType.description: bundle type, eg: vm, container, module

deploymentType.description: type of deployment for the app, eg: azure, k3s, standalone

VMManifestSummary.title: VMManifestSummary - App summary for list views

VariableFileEncoding.description:
- FILE_ENCODING_UNSPECIFIED: File content not encoded
 - FILE_ENCODING_BASE64: File content encoded in Base64
VariableFileEncoding.title: File content encoding type

VariableVariableFormat.description:
- VARIABLE_FORMAT_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_TEXT: Value in string format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_NUMBER: Value in integer format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_FILE: Value to be read from a file
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_DROPDOWN: Value to be selected from dropdown of options
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_BOOLEAN: Value in boolean format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_PASSWORD: Value in string to be masked in User-Agent
VariableVariableFormat.title: Custom variable format

ZcOpsStatus.description:
- OPS_STATUS_PENDING: In rare cases, system may not start operation when it was requested. Client will be notified that operation is PENDING
 - OPS_STATUS_ONGOING: system will start the operation, but at the time response was generated, operation is still ONGOING.
 - OPS_STATUS_COMPLETE: Even if the result of the operations may result in failure, but the OpsStatus will marked COMPLETE for almost all cases.
ZcOpsStatus.title: ZedCloud internal operation status

ec.title:
Enumrated error code, describes more granular numerical
value than just httpStatus

details.title: Field captures string description of details

ZsrvErrorCode.description:
- zMsgErrorNone: common validation errors
 - IncompleteData: message had fields that weren't filled in
 - InvalidData: message contained the field that wasn't expected
 - FunctionUnsupported: this feature unavailable on this version of device
 - InvalidFieldFormat: message contained the field that wasn't correctly formatted
 - JsonFmtError: Marshal / Unmarshal errors
 - DataBaseConnection: generic DB error
ZsrvErrorCode.title: ZedCould internal error code

operationType.title:
Describes one of the operations type : possible values
                        Read/Delete/Create/Update/List

operationStatus.title: if this is log running job

objectKind.title: zedcloud object kind on which the operation was performed

objectId.title: Unique value identifies the object that was operated on

objectRevision.title:
object revision post the operation, note Read operation
doesn't change the revision

user.title: the operation is performed on behalf of this user

httpStatusMsg.title: summary of the error in text format

error.title:
one or more errors will be set if the operation failed
i.e. httpStatusCode != 2xx

name.description: User defined name of the app ACE, unique across the enterprise. Once object is created, name can’t be changed

netname.description: network name: will be deprecated in future, use netinstname

io.description: Physical Adapter to be matched for interface assignment. Applicable only when "direct attach" flag is true

directattach.title: comes from manifest during app create

ipaddr.title:
if netname points static DHCP then we need to take
static /32 address here

macaddr.title:
in case of p2v we might want to provide a mac-address.
applicable only in case of DHCP=passthrough

accessVlanId.description: access port VLAN ID, vlan id of zero will be treated as trunk port and vlan id 1 is implicitly used by linux bridges

eidregister.title: FIXME: Check why is this required

netinstname.description: Network Instance name to be matched for interface assignment. Applicable only when "direct attach" flag is false

preserve.description: Preserves flag which preserves the volume

volumelabel.description: User defined volume to use for this drive

ignorepurge.description: don't purge this Drive, only applicable to purge command

hvMode.description:
For now we need to tell the device which virtualization mode
to use. Later we might use a single one for all VMs (on any particular
ISA). If we end up keeping this we should make the names be less
tied to a particular hypervisor.

type.description: IoType specifies the type of the Input output of the device

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.
